titleInfo.title: A map of the states of Virginia, North Carolina, South Carolina, and Georgia; comprehending the Spanish provinces of East and West Florida (1794)

mods.abstract: Map of Virginia, North Carolina, South Carolina, and Georgia showing national borders, state borders, Native American territorial boundaries, towns, and Native American villages. The coast has a highly detailed depiction of inlets, capes, bays, and rivers. Roads, mines, counties, caves, and springs are shown, including the Cherokee (Tennessee) River which is wrongly said to be ""Navigable 900 M[ile]s."" Unique features include lands of the Ohio Company, Army Lands in present-day Ohio, General Clark's grant, Army Lands in present-day Illinois, and the Cumberland Settlements (misplaced) and the ""New State of Franklin"" in present-day Tennessee. While dated 1794, this map depicts an earlier state of things, such as Franklin which by then had gone out of existence, Tennessee as still part of North Carolina, Kentucky as part of Virginia, and Georgia extending to the Mississippi River.

subject.topic: Indians of North America--Southern States--Maps--Early works to 1800
Eastern Band of Cherokee Indians of North Carolina--Maps--Early works to 1800

subject.geographic: Virginia; North Carolina; South Carolina; Georgia; Tennessee; Southeast
